ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned SO MUCH in this class. We had awesome discussions that spanned from the female experience of slavery to questioning what is "blackness" and what has it been in the past to how the repercussions of slavery are still with us today in the united states.

I loved how this class primarily looked at the history of slavery through the lens of literature. I initially thought "Afterlives of Slavery" would deal with ways in which institutions similar to slavery are still present in America today (ie: mass incarceration). However, I loved that the class focused on ways in which we internalize, write about, remember, and perceive of the peculiar institution by exploring slavery as a form of capitalism, and by reading both contemporary diaries from slaves and modern literature on slavery.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is amazing. You get the chance to read excellent autobiographies, novels, and historic books about slavery and its impact on racism.
This class was excellent all around

I am torn, because on the one hand I love that we got through so much material, but on the other hand I wish we had gotten to spend more time on each of the works we read. That being said, I loved the array of works we were exposed to, including the films. I also loved that each of us got the opportunity to lead the seminar.
Great selection of texts and well taught!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. This course will change the way you look at the world.
Definitely! Phenomenal course with a phenomenal professor!

I would recommend this course to another student who is looking for a tight-knit seminar, and someone who loves literature. While some of the readings could be challenging, as a class we broke them down and made them all manageable. Overall, I learned a great deal and definitely think about slavery in a new light.
